intro: Conyza candolleana, commonly known as the white cudweed, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia and Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in disturbed soils and can be found in open fields, roadsides, and waste areas. Its small white flowers bloom in the summer, and it has finely divided, grass-like leaves. Conyza candolleana is also known for its ability to thrive in arid conditions, making it a common weed in many regions.
